item.description:
The group will hike the easy 2.75 mile route around Burr Pond. Bring dinner, bug spray, and a bathing suit if you want to swim in the pond or a kayak if you want to paddle after the event (not part of the offical event).

This is a narrow woodland trail being somewhat rocky with snaking roots in parts and rolling terrain, so any children really should be physically fit and over the age of 7 years. There is one tricky detour near a dam, which people could miss. We also pass through the public beach area about 3/4 of the way to the end of the hike.

Burr Pond State Park offers hiking, Bathrooms, Boat Launch, Food Concessions, Picnic Shelter, Picnic Tables, swimming, canoe/kayak rentals.

Meet at 2 PM at the north parking lot off of Burr Mountain Rd. (at the boat launch -see the map). We believe the north lot is still free to park at. To get to the main east lot there is a $7 CT resident/$10 non-resident per car entrance fee to the park. Carpooling is encouraged.

Any questions, please contact the event leader John H (http://hiking.meetup.....

***Do NOT make any payment via Paypal! Pay your share at the meetup.***

Park map is at:
http://dep.state.ct.u...

For more information, see http://dep.state.ct.u...

group.name: The Hartford Area Hikingâ„¢ Meetup Group

item.name: John H's Hike to Burr Pond State Park, Torrington CT
